item.title: SMB-focused Finom closes €115M as European fintech heats up
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Finom, an Amsterdam-based challenger bank for SMBs that claims to have doubled its revenue in 2024, closed a €115 million Series C equity round (around $133 million).

item.title: OpenAI pulls promotional materials around Jony Ive deal due to court order
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: OpenAI appears to have pulled a much-discussed video promoting the friendship between CEO Sam Altman and legendary Apple designer Jony Ive (plus, incidentally, OpenAI’s $6.5 billion deal to acquire Ive and Altman’s device startup io) from its website and YouTube page.

item.title: Tesla launches robotaxi rides in Austin with big promises and unanswered questions
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane, Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Tesla has started giving rides in driverless Model Y SUVs in Austin. Details are still sparse, but limited service is open to vetted and invited riders.

item.title: Why Danny Boyle shot ‘28 Years Later’ on iPhones
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Director Danny Boyle famously shot his post-apocalyptic classic “28 Days Later” on Canon digital cameras, making it easier for him to capture eerie scenes of an abandoned London, and giving the movie’s fast-moving zombies a terrifying immediacy. To make his decades-later sequel “28 Years Later” (which opened this weekend), Boyle turned to a different piece […]

item.title: The stablecoin evangelist: Katie Haun’s fight for digital dollars
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: In 2018, when Bitcoin was trading around $4,000 and most Americans, at least, thought cryptocurrency was a fad, Katie Haun found herself on a debate stage in Mexico City opposite Paul Krugman, the Nobel Prize-winning economist. As Krugman focused on Bitcoin's wild price swings, Haun steered the conversation toward something else — stablecoins.

item.title: Moratorium on state AI regulation clears Senate hurdle
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A Republican effort to prevent states from enforcing their own AI regulations cleared a key procedural hurdle on Saturday.

item.title: LinkedIn CEO says AI writing assistant is not as popular as expected
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: While LinkedIn users seem to have embraced AI, there’s one area that’s seen less uptake than expected, according to CEO Ryan Roslansky: the AI-generated suggestions for polishing your LinkedIn posts.

item.title: Last day to save on your TechCrunch All Stage pass — prices go up tonight
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: It’s now or never — this is your final day to lock in savings for TechCrunch All Stage, happening July 15 in Boston. Prices increase tonight, June 22, at 11:59 p.m. PT. If you’ve been thinking about attending, now’s the time to commit. Register here. TC All Stage brings together founders, investors, and operators from […]

item.title: European leaders worry they’re too reliant on U.S. tech
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: European governments may be reconsidering their use of American technology and services, according to a new report in The New York Times.

item.title: Cartoonist Paul Pope is more worried about killer robots than AI plagiarism
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Paul Pope has written and drawn some of the most gorgeous comics of the twenty-first century — from “Batman: Year 100,” in which Batman challenges a dystopian surveillance state, to “Battling Boy,” with its adolescent god proving his mettle by fighting giant monsters. But it’s been more than a decade since Pope’s last major comics […]

item.title: Week in Review: Meta reveals its Oakley smart glasses
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review! Lots in store for you today, including Wix’s latest acquisition, Meta’s new smart glasses, a look at the new Digg, and much more. Have a great weekend! Smart specs: Meta and Oakley have teamed up on a new pair of smart glasses that can record 3K video, play music, […]

item.title: 2 days left to save up to $210 on your TechCrunch All Stage pass
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Time is almost up! Regular bird pricing for TechCrunch All Stage ends this Sunday, June 22, at 11:59 p.m. PT. That means you have just 2 days left to lock in savings of up to $210 on your ticket to one of the ultimate founder events of the summer. TC All Stage lands in Boston […]

item.title: Rippling spy says men have been following him, and his wife is afraid
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: If becoming a corporate spy sounds exciting, let this newest affidavit from confessed Rippling spy Keith O’Brien serve as a warning.

item.title: Mira Murati’s Thinking Machines Lab closes on $2B at $10B valuation
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Thinking Machines Lab, the secretive AI startup founded by OpenAI’s former chief technology officer Mira Murati, has closed a $2 billion seed round at a $10 billion valuation.

item.title: Cluely, a startup that helps ‘cheat on everything,’ raises $15M from a16z
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Cluely's new funding comes roughly two months after it raised $5.3 million in seed funding co-led by Abstract Ventures and Susa Ventures.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Applied Intuition’s eye-popping valuation, the new age of micromobility, and Waymo’s wild week
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation. Sign up here for free — just click TechCrunch Mobility! Waymo might be the largest commercial robotaxi operator — offering 250,000 paid rides per week — but it is hardly smooth.  The past seven days in Waymo’s […]

item.title: Anthropic says most AI models, not just Claude, will resort to blackmail
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Several weeks after Anthropic released research claiming that its Claude Opus 4 AI model resorted to blackmailing engineers who tried to turn the model off in controlled test scenarios, the company is out with new research suggesting the problem is more widespread among leading AI models.

item.title: The new math: Why seed investors are selling their winners earlier
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: After two decades in venture capital, Hudson has been watching the math of seed investing change, maybe permanently. LPs who've previously been patient with seven-to-eight-year hold periods are suddenly asking questions about interim liquidity.

item.title: Snap acquires Saturn, a social calendar app for high school and college students
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Snap has acquired Saturn, a calendar app that helps students manage their school schedules and share them with others.

item.title: The startups rolling out of Europe’s early-stage micromobility scene
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: A handful of early stage micromobility startups out of Europe that are filling the gaps in a maturing ecosystem.
